New Records: Nick Martinez pitched six strong innings for his third straight win
Key Match Events: TJ Friedl went 4 for 4 with a two-run homer
Jake Fraley had three hits for the Reds, including a solo homer
Cincinnati scored nine times in the fourth to put away the game early
Jonathan India followed with a two-run single
Spencer Steer had a two-run double
Friedl a two-run homer, his second longball in as many nights
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds manager David Bell said Martinez has been on a great roll and has a great changeup, but he has really six different pitches that he can use and throw for strikes
Post-Match Reflections: Twins infielder Kyle Farmer said the team needs to get back towards the mindset of taking it rather than giving it up
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said the team has been pressing on the offensive side of the ball and needs to play with urgency and play relaxed and play loose
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota remained 2 1/2 games ahead of Detroit for the final American League playoff berth
The Reds' win was their third straight win for Martinez
The Twins have lost eight of 11 games
